alert.note: Alert for Chattooga; Floyd; Gordon (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Floyd, southwestern Gordon and central Chattooga Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 300 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Everett Springs to near Holland to Fullerton, and moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Rome, Calhoun, Summerville, Plainville, Lyerly, Oostanaula, Tidings, Armuchee, Coosa, Berryton, Chattoogaville, Everett Springs, James H. Floyd State Park, and Holland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
